Name:  ___                 Unit No:   ___

Hypertension, N/V 
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
Colonoscopy

 
History of Present Illness:
___ male with history of A. fib on apixaban, AS s/p 
TAVR,
hypertension, myasthenia ___, presenting with 2 hours of
diaphoresis, malaise, abdominal pain. 

The patient was seen in ED on ___ due to syncope.  He had an
unremarkable head CT and was monitored overnight with serial
troponins, EKG prior to discharge to ___.  

Of note, the patient was also seen by neurology ___ and self
tapered himself off of his prednisone from 15mg daily. He was
instructed for a slow taper from 15 to 12.5 mg daily this month.

Patient had a SCC removed from his scalp on ___.  He has a
fill history for cefadroxil 500mg PO daily but does not remember
taking this or what it is for. 

Patient reports that he woke up ___ and did not feel well. He
developed abdominal pain in his lower central abdomen without
radiation. He endorsed bowel urgency with this pain and had two
bloody, formed, stools, last 3pm on ___. He states the blood
was pink around his stool without melena. He felt diaphoretic
during these episodes of abdominal pain. He had some nausea but
no vomiting. He did not feel hungry today so did not eat. Pain
not worse with movement but mildly improved with Tylenol. 
Reports
feeling general malaise, unwell. He denies shortness of breath 
or
chest pain. Nausea without vomiting. 

 
Past Medical History:
Aortic stenosis s/p TAVR in ___
HF pEF, EF > 55%
Myasthenia ___
Hypertension
Hyperlipidemia
Asthma
Hyperparathyroidism
Vitamin D deficiency
Non-obstructing renal calculus
Atrial ectopy
T11 compression deformity-incidental compression fracture found 
on CT
Squamous cell carcinoma of scalp s/p excision on ___

CT ABD:
IMPRESSION: 
  
  
1. Findings concerning for colitis at the splenic flexure which 
may be 
inflammatory, infectious, or ischemic in etiology. 
2. Prostatomegaly. 
3. Re-demonstration of T11 and T12 compression deformities. 

CT HEAD:
IMPRESSION: 
  
  
1. No acute intracranial hemorrhage or mass effect. 
2. Soft tissue swelling and subcutaneous gas likely from 
laceration within the 
posterior scalp vertex.  No acute fractures. 
3. Worsening left maxillary sinus disease for which correlation 
with acute 
sinusitis is recommended. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
PATIENT SUMMARY
================
Mr. ___ is a ___ male with history of A. fib on 
apixaban, AS s/p TAVR, hypertension, and myasthenia ___, who 
presented with diaphoresis, malaise, abdominal pain, and melena. 
He underwent a colonoscopy without evidence for colitis or 
active GI bleed and his symptoms resolved without further 
intervention or treatment.

ACTIVE ISSUES:
==============
# Colitis, NOS
# Bloody stools
# Concern for GI bleed
The patient presented with bloody bowel movements, abdominal 
pain, and concern for colitis on imaging. He was also started on 
zosyn in ED due to concern for diverticulitis, however 
antibiosis was discontinued after further review of imaging. The 
patient remained afebrile without leukocytosis. Hbg was stable 
throughout. He underwent a colonoscopy which showed no evidence 
for colitis, but did reveal a large colon polyp and internal 
hemmorhoids. His abdominal pain resolved as he was continued on 
his home bowel regimen. 

# Demand Ischemia
Troponins were mildly elevated on admission without concerning 
ST changes or symptoms on EKG, however EKG was difficult to 
interpret given baseline LAFB and RBBB in setting of prior TAVR. 
Troponins were trended until flat.

# Scalp wound
Scalp wound with oozing s/p recent ___ excision. Hemostasis was 
achieved with standard wound care. Staples were left in with 
plans for patient to have them removed as an outpatient.

# Hypomagnesemia
Repleted IV magnesium as needed.

CHRONIC ISSUES:
===============
# Anemia
Baseline Hgb ___. The patient appeared to be at baseline this 
admission with out evidence for bleeding. He was continued on 
frrous sulfate.

# HFpEF
The patient was euvolemic this admission so his home furosemide 
was held. He was continued on home metoprolol. His home imdur 
was held initially and then restarted on discharge.

# Afib 
Patient with history of atrial fibrillation on apixaban.
CHADS2VSC of 4. He was continued on apixaban after colonoscopy 
showed no major bleeding. He was also continued home metoprolol.

# HTN
The patient's home lisinopril and imdur were held on admission 
due to initial concerns for bleeding and infection as noted 
above. They were restarted on day of discharge. 

# HLD
The patient was continued on his home statin. 

# Asthma
He was given duonebs as needed.

# Myasthenia ___
The patient was continued on home cellcept and prednisone 12.5mg 
daily.

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
===================
[] Due to new osteoporosis on his CT with wedge compression 
fractures, would consider starting calcium and vitamin D.
[] Per GI: Large polyp found on colonoscopy and recommending 
follow-up colonoscopy in 6 months for polpectomy.
[] Furosemide was held while inpatient, please assess for volume 
status and restart if needed.
[] The patient was continued on him home prednisone on discharge 
12.5 mg, with deference to PCP regarding plans for taper.
[] Held home BP meds while inpatient. Restarted lisinopril and 
imdur on discharge. Please assess BP and check Chem 7 within one 
week of discharge.

#CODE: Full (confirmed)
#CONTACT: ___ ___ (nephew)

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure caring for you at ___ 
___!

WHY WERE YOU ADMITTED?
- You came to the hospital with high blood pressure, nausea, 
dizziness, and fainting.

WHAT HAPPENED IN THE HOSPITAL?
- In the hospital you were given fluids through your vein.
- You were given medicine for your blood pressure.
- Stomach and intestine doctors came to ___ you for blood in 
your stool.
- You had a colonoscopy which showed a polyp which we informed 
you about.

WHAT SHOULD YOU DO AT HOME?
- Take all your medications.
- Keep all of your appointments.

WHEN SHOULD YOU COME BACK TO THE HOSPITAL?
- Please return if you experience more nausea, dizziness, or if 
you faint again. 

Thank you for allowing us be involved in your care, we wish you 
all the best!

Your ___ Team

 
Followup Instructions:
___

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
